name: Brut - Restaurant & Traiteur gastronomique bio
search_query: Brut Restaurant Traiteur gastronomique bio Brussels Ixelles

reviews.text: An incredible experience in a warm and welcoming atmosphere, with Alice's cooking bursting with flavor! The work done on all the vegetarian dishes is impressive. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Thank you to the whole team!
It was a wonderful experience! We had the four-course menu and the fish as an extra. Divine! We'll be back.

A wonderful rediscovery of this place. We've known Brut for a long time, but hadn't had the chance to go for three years.

We were delighted with the vegetarian menu. Fish or meat options can be added upon request, but honestly, they don't seem necessary; the way they work with vegetables is fantastic.
The "Gueule de Joie" (non-alcoholic) option, paired with the menu, is refreshing, and the setting is pleasant and sophisticated.
We'll gladly return.

A wonderful discovery bursting with flavor! I loved exploring the forest path! The chef regularly travels and attends training courses to introduce us to new tastes and truly exceptional dishes! The service is very friendly and efficient. They offer wine pairings or food and non-alcoholic options, ensuring everyone can benefit from the sommelier's explanations! In short, a flawless experience from start to finish.

On behalf of the entire Heidrick & Struggles team, I wanted to thank you for the excellent welcome, service, and menu on the evening of December 10th. A special thank you to Quentin, who provided impeccable service and a wonderful smile throughout the evening.

We had a delightful time!
Delicious food, warm service, and a homey atmosphere. I'd love to come back! :)

Still as good as ever. Special mention for the walk through the forest in the dishes of the moment and the food and wine pairings and food and non-alcoholic drinks pairings, presented with talent by the sommelier.
It‚Äôs amazing how the staff here deal with customers.
Wonderful experience!! Local, seasonal, organic and completely vegetarian unless you choose to add animal protein. Cozy atmosphere, not overly fancy.

I was able to privatize the restaurant to eat there for a teambuilding event. Great buffet, top-notch service, seamless communication before, during, and after. I highly recommend it. I also went there with friends afterward, it was the best!
Hello to the whole team, it was a wonderful experience, thank you
Delicious and cozy!
Delivery for a meal for 14 people, with 8 different dishes. Everything was delicious, original, and superb.
We had a wonderful meal! The service was pleasant and tailored to your needs. Highly recommended! Time flew by as we sampled each course.
Unequal quality of dishes and long service time.
Excellent food with interesting combinations and good service. t

We had the pleasure of celebrating our family birthdays at Brut, and what an unforgettable experience! ‚ú®
We chose the 6-course menu: a true gastronomic adventure, remarkably refined and creative. Chef Alice dazzled us with every dish, a true journey of the senses! üåü
The attentive and kind service made the experience even more beautiful. I loved the superb selection of natural wines, and what an incredible discovery the orange wine was‚Äîan absolute delight üòã
The venue, at once elegant, warm, and friendly, contributes to this unique atmosphere.
In a word: a gem of great gastronomy in Brussels, a must-see!

What an evening! What service! Thanks to S√©bastien for the delicious cocktail, the dining room staff for the service, and to the entire kitchen team who delighted our taste buds!
I would recommend this place without hesitation!
Bravo again!
Unpleasant staff from the first exchange, and aggressive

Get ready for watermelon sushi and oyster ice-cream... Creativity gets to a level where we lose the point: most of the dishes are simply not good or not tasty. The same night I had nightmares with pop-corns made with ants.... In all this, the service is friendly but not professional and the bill is far too high.

We had quite high expectations, it's true, but...
- The culinary experience: we had some good things (nothing more) and others that were honestly useless, I'm sincerely sorry. The fake sushi with watermelon or the oyster mousse/ice cream starter... neither good nor interesting and probably unnecessarily expensive.
- The service: All nice, yes, but there was a gentleman who seemed to be there by chance and a lady who was really, really excited... it almost made us feel uncomfortable. But all very kind and helpful.
- The price: well, you know, being in a restaurant where you'll pay a lot, you expect that, but it must correspond to a certain level of experience. Honestly, for what we ate (and of course the quantities), it was borderline rip-off, sorry.

In short, I'm sad, but it was a really bad experience.

Great evening.
Very nice restaurant, excellent and surprising cuisine, impeccable service.
Perfect
creative, full of variety, very attentive staff

The atmosphere is nice, the food interesting, but not extraordinary either: nice but not extraordinary starters, delicious tomatoes but very average sushi and eggplant plate also not at all gourmet. Service a little too slow. Not at all in ‚Ä¶

Definitely one of the best restaurants in Brussels. Wonderful food, the various vegetarian courses, each with the option of meat or fish side dishes, are varied yet perfectly matched. Highly recommended, especially with the wine pairing. ‚Ä¶

Great team! Super nice service. A great combination of professionalism, hospitality, and friendliness. The chef serves you one deliciously refined meal after another on your plate. For the quality received, the price is more than fair. You ‚Ä¶
Simply perfect! Thank you.
Impeccable service, top-notch cuisine. Casual yet luxurious.
It‚Äôs a lovely experience ‚Äî I really enjoy how they use local, organic ingredients in their dishes.

A wonderful experience. Primarily vegetarian, but offers a variety of complementary options to satisfy all types of customers. In my opinion, the vegetarian dishes are perfectly satisfying on their own, thanks to the original and generous ‚Ä¶

A moment of happiness for the taste buds... very nice creativity throughout the menu... a simply magical oyster sorbet... and an assortment of natural wines combining variety and quality... we will be back!

A fantastic experience at Brut: the food is surprisingly creative and equally good. This oyster sorbet was to die for ! The service is knowledgeable and very kind. Wine by the glass was worth it, too. A great evening, while feeling good altogether, because it is healthy, organic, and mostly vegetarian.
This place has everything you want to experience ‚ô°

Sometimes, very occasionally,
everything comes together.

The atmosphere settles over the room
like a soft blanket,
music breathing with the moment.

The kitchen and the service understand you without words,
gliding by
as if everything were weightless,
with an incomparable calm.

And yet there is a subtle dynamism,
almost at odds with that calm,
which, together with the music,
draws you into
a gently disorienting, deeply pleasant state.

From this alone arises
an unacceptably pleasant experience.

And the food
what can you call it?

To call something heavenly
would mean it is not of this planet.

And yet it is.

When you step outside again,
you realise
you have been somewhere else for a moment
on the planet Eliane,
in the Kobe galaxy.

It is almost impossible to imagine
where you were for that moment,
far away from the mad world.

So, after all,
is there a heaven on earth?

If so,
it must be here.

On a blue Friday,
an evening like no other
in the past fifty-nine years
comes into being.

With gratitude for this evening.
Koen Breakman
Sublime!
Very good
An exceptional gastronomic experience. Elegant setting, impeccable service, and refined dishes. Perfect for a special occasion.
The service is elegant and distinctive, and the food is delicious.
A remarkable culinary and musical selection!
Truly amazing, feels like you‚Äôre inside of a film scene. Every detail thoughtfully considered, an unforgettable lunch.
Tremendous place. Such nice people and food. Thank you very very much.

Quite an incredible experience!
Every time, everything is perfect!

All dishes were delicious and well balanced. Few dishes were very memorable: smoked sardines, pear sorbet, red mullet. Only the main course was quite salty (the only meat on the menu), neither of us could finish it.

Service was excellent. Very good recommendation of the wine. Would be better the menu was given at the beginning not at last.

What an experience! We certainly had high expectations, knowing what Kobe can achieve in terms of flavor and texture in his dishes. They were definitely exceeded. It was beautiful to see and taste. Fantastic! Even the customized juices we ordered were always spot on. We look back on this fantastic experience with great pleasure and emotion.

Even though I was traveling alone, this meal felt like I was with family from the moment I stepped inside.  From the entire Eliane team to the other guests I was seated with, the experience was phenomenal, and I left with friends.  And then there‚Äôs the food‚Äîpurposefully executed and delicious.  Bravo!
Kobe, well-selected vinyls and the most delicious dishes, what more do you need?!

√âliane restaurant offers a lovely dining experience with refined and beautifully presented dishes. The flavors are spot-on, the plates are elegant, and the service is pleasant. You can taste the effort behind each dish. However, given all the positive reviews I'd heard, I was expecting something a little more exceptional. It was good, but not as memorable as I'd hoped.

We came to Eliane's with high expectations, driven by the chef's reputation and the originality of the concept.

From the moment we arrived, we were captivated: the setting is splendid, the staging immersive, the lighting and soundtrack perfectly designed. It's like being in a movie, watching the chefs in action. The service is also impeccable: the team is warm, smiling, and always attentive.

Unfortunately, out of about twenty dishes served, we encountered three major errors that, in an establishment of this caliber, are difficult to accept:

A squid ink risotto so salty that we couldn't finish it.

A perfectly cooked piece of meat that was sorely lacking in salt (an error that was apparently corrected in the next course).
The most shocking: a rotten cherry served for dessert.

What disappointed us most was the attitude toward these problems. When we reported the rotten cherry, we received only a simple "sorry." No apology from the chef, even though he was present 50 cm from our table when we left. I also took the time to send a detailed review by email following their request, without receiving the slightest response.

In conclusion, fifteen of the eighteen dishes were probably delicious, but when you have such ambitions, three mistakes, including a rotten piece of fruit, are inexcusable. The team's total lack of consideration and apologies turns a culinary disappointment into a real frustration.
A shame for an establishment that has everything it takes to excel but seems to forget the importance of after-sales service and acknowledging its mistakes.

I had an absolutely wonderful dinner at Elaine in Brussels and cannot recommend it highly enough. From start to finish, the experience felt thoughtful and personal. The food itself was exceptional, beautifully presented, full of flavor, and clearly crafted with care and creativity. Each course was a delight and flowed seamlessly into the next.

What made my evening especially memorable, though, was the attention to detail in the hospitality. I was dining alone, and in between courses the staff offered me a book to enjoy. They even selected one in English, my native language, which was such a considerate and unexpected touch. It turned what could have been a quiet gap into a genuinely enjoyable and warm moment, making me feel completely at ease.

Elaine strikes a perfect balance between refined dining and genuine hospitality. The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, the service attentive without ever being overbearing, and the small touches truly elevate the entire experience. I left not only satisfied with an excellent meal but also feeling cared for in a way that is rare to find.

I will most certainly return the next time I am in Brussels, and I would encourage anyone looking for a memorable dining experience to do the same.
An exceptionally beautiful evening filled with delicious dishes. It was an unforgettable experience.
Delicious food, friendly staff, very ‚Äòhomie-feeling‚Äô with a great atmosphere. Only point that we desliked were the chairs that were not comfortable. But definitely to recommend, 10/10!

I don't know where to start, if you love food and everything about it, this will be an emotional journey.

This is a testament for gastronomy, a masterclass cuisson and flavour. I don't like to pull out superlatives but this place deserves all of it. üôè
A magical evening...from the beginning we were surprised by the quality of the meal and the atmosphere until the end...what a joy
Ridiculously perfect experience. Great vibes, music, drinks, ‚Ä¶ and the food, wauw. Already looking for an excuse to come back.
Fantastic lunch today, 18 courses including wine pairing. Harmonious team work between kitchen, waiters and music. Relaxed atmosphere. Brilliant place for exquisite food
A perfect combo of excellent food, service and music.

Fortunate enough to have visited In De Wulf early Summer of 2016 it is regrettable that Chambre S√©par√©e closed prior to a return to Belgium, so when Kobe Desramaults announced Eliane a flight was booked almost immediately.

Belgian by birth, his start in cooking ostensibly when his mother opened a Bar called In De Wulf that he later took over after time cooking at Picasso and Oud Sluis, Desramaults style is intentionally simple and Ingredient focused in a way that resembles the work of Michel Bras but more aggressive in terms of flavor.

Marked by just a doorbell, a glass pane sliding open to warm greetings, Eliane comprises just 22 seats including half at a bar where guests get to watch Desramaults and staff work largely with flames and standard kitchen equipment as 26 creations come together from local, seasonal proteins and produce.

Named after Chef's grandmother, his devotion to family a recurring theme across Desramaults‚Äô past and present, the project is clearly a personal one including the sizable vinyl soundtrack and Kobe working every station from start to cleanup.

Not the sort of place where analyzing each dish enhances the experience, a chance to watch such a virtuoso performance rarer and rarer these days, early bites found a Vegetable Tart with Smoked Sardine and Clams in Pine shoot Vinegar particularly compelling before a truly exceptional preparation of North Sea Crab and Green Beans in Champagne Sabayon.

Consistently turning Pigeons over the embers all night, no gadgets just commitment, Potatoes with local Buttermilk next find themselves upgraded by Yolk and Belgian Caviar while Desramaults breaks down a whole Turbot, whisking its juices into one of several beautiful Sauces.

Not shy with portions, Bread with a quenelle of Butter best kept at arm‚Äôs length for those with smaller appetites, Mussels and Leeks offer quick bites before handmade Pasta that isn‚Äôt afraid to showcase Chlorophyll prior to Lobster truly using the whole Animal.

Perhaps sourcing his few months in Sicily with Sepia Risotto, an elegant segue to dueling mains, Lamb finds itself highlighted by Ramson Juice and a Tomato Tart prior to the aforementioned Birds with their Livers and a hint of Mint.

Now switching to the Pastry station after a nibble of Cheese Eliane‚Äôs Desserts continue a trend of elegance in simplicity with Meadowsweet Ice Cream atop Cherries and Fresh Almonds a standout along with a finishing Rhubarb Millefeuille.

The 2019 experience at Chambre S√©par√©e in Ghent made me question what true gastronomic value could be‚Äîsomething beyond the confines of Michelin stars and formal accolades.

Even before stepping inside, the gentle greeting of woodsmoke warmed me up. The playlist, the space, the way the staff moved‚Äîeverything was sensuous and intentional. Looking back, maybe I was just intoxicated by the place, the people, the time.

I still remember the gay couple next to us, licking every bit of the venison sauce off their plates with their fingers. It was that relaxed‚Äîunpretentious yet elegant, effortlessly stylish. The restaurant eventually closed around the time of the pandemic, but the tender warmth of that experience lingered long after. I kept following Chef Kobe Desramaults‚Äô journey, from hotels and pop-ups to finally opening Eliane in Brussels. The catch? It‚Äôs closed on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays‚Äîmaking it a real challenge to schedule a visit.

Michelin stars, World‚Äôs 50 Best‚Äînone of that really matters to me. He‚Äôs the kind of chef who awakens your senses. He‚Äôs simply faithful to his own sensory world and creative universe, and the results naturally follow. It‚Äôs not about striving or chasing prestige‚Äîit‚Äôs about expressing one‚Äôs way of being. Maybe that‚Äôs what mastery is: the delicate craftsmanship of making the natural feel inevitable. The quiet elegance of an artist.

Even the butter served with bread had a texture and aroma that stood out. I asked about it‚Äîand of course, it was made in-house with cream from cows raised on an organic farm, fed only fresh herbs and grass. Cultured and churned by hand.

Of course. Any house with soul knows that even the condiments deserve intention. There are no throwaways.

Absolutely fabulous! The best food experience you can have at the moment,  and that's just not in Brussels or Belgium. That's anywhere. From the sensitivity in the taste combinations, the ambience and the music from the record players, the precision in the timing of the dishes and the intelligence with which the sommelier was describing the perfectly paired wines. Hats off to Kobe&team. Really, really very, very good!
A truly excellent experience! Flawless, a relatively relaxed atmosphere, but high-quality dishes expertly prepared and the service impeccable.

Best restaurant I‚Äôve been in years! Without a doubt.
Bravo mr Desramault.

Amazing experience with a great menu in 20 steps.
The atmosphere is great, lounge, nice music and open kitchen in the same area. We ate at the main table just in front the chef and the team.
Dishes were stunning with long lasting tastes, herbal flavors and surprising and perfect match.
The wine and spirits pairing is great. Service is super nice as on top of the two main service manager each of the crew come to serve.
Really worth to go if you can.

This is by far one of the best restaurants I visited.
From the moment you enter the door, wait even before that, the moment I stared in the street to make sure if its the right place the host already came to welcome me .
The atmosphere is amazing, cozy, warm, familial yet very  professional and clean.
You are witnessing a full show of harmony and cooking in the best and professional way kitchen can be.
The wines - best I had . Every wine was mind blowing and it took me a moment to capture this happy moment of sipping each one of them. Really extraordinary.
For the food- from the first bite to the last dessert everything was done to perfection.
10/10
Delicious, ridiculously delicious.
The price ain‚Äôt cheap, honestly I think its the most amount of money I put in a restaurant, but got to be honest, I already want to go back again.
It is worth it! Finally a place that respect ingredients and treats them with passion and respect with A LOT of small details and attention that makes the diffrence.
Well done.

I have been at Kobe Desramault's three Michelin star restauant In de Wulf long ago. Visiting Eliane feels like coming home. Literally. They cater for only 20 people but the atmosphere, service, food and wines, ... are groovy. I wish that more restaurants had this awesome way to pleasure foodies.

Fantastic experience. Incredibly delicious food and truly friendly service.
Thank you for an unforgettable evening.

An exceptional experience from beginning to end. I was delighted to have watched or read virtually nothing about this place beforehand so that I could simply let myself be carried away by the experience.
Absolutely fantastic experience! World class. Brilliant. Words fail me.

Exceptional! Kobe confirms he's one of the best Belgian chefs!

The succession of dishes was dazzling, with some truly rare combinations.

We were lucky enough to taste hop shoots. The standout dishes: the risotto with oysters, the exceptional red mullet paired with grapefruit, and the celeriac and mackerel.
The wine pairing was equally perfect.
The musical ambiance was varied and carefully selected by the chef himself, who was spinning his vinyl records!

And the service was attentive and very friendly.
In short, thank you to the team and the chef for this exceptional experience :)

A real eye-opener!

Impeccable service, from the reservation to waiting list management, right up to the reception at the restaurant.
Very professional welcome, a very large stone table facing the kitchen, and the entire staff.
The dishes came together quite quickly and very professionally.

And, above all, an extraordinary culinary experience, a succession of tastings (22 in total!), each one more appetizing than the last, the freshness of the ingredients, the inventiveness of the combinations, the cooking, sometimes over a wood fire, perfect, and the extremely efficient service.

A real eye-opener from start to finish.

If you only visit one restaurant a year, this is the place to come!

Congratulations to Chef Kobe, his assistants, and the entire staff for this unique experience!

Budget for 2 people with wine > ‚Ç¨700
An extraordinary journey

Quite an incredible experience. It's been a long time since I've been so impressed by a chef. The menu consists of no fewer than 18 creations, and they are indeed creations, sometimes very inventive (both in terms of textures and product combinations).
Among these are noble and extremely fresh ingredients (langoustines, caviar, crab, oysters, truffles, scallops, red mullet, turbot, etc.).
You need to have some time (more than 3 hours), and of course, it's a high budget, but it's definitely worth it.
Also very enjoyable:
- The kitchen is open and you can watch the various dishes being prepared.
- The chef is present throughout the service and comes in several times to present his creations himself. The only tiny downside: the music was sometimes too loud, but I'm convinced that was due to poor handling (this wasn't the case at all throughout the lunch, only a small part).
Kobe has landed! Casual and refined. Gems with a price to match. Great atmosphere, top-notch wine list.
Exceptional

I would follow you across the galaxy ü™ê
The uniqueness of existence is complete in this interstellar journey. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•
