reviews.text: We absolutely love this restaurant! While the food is delicious and the prices are a great value, it's the outstanding service that truly sets it apart. The owner is a true gem, he's always so welcoming and genuinely goes out of his way to ensure every customer has a wonderful experience. 10/10 recommend! :)
Very friendly service and the food was ok/good. In our opinion it was quite salty, but overall we had a good experience.

"A warm welcome made me feel right at home from the moment I arrived. And the food? Incredible! Each dish is packed with flavor, just like a home-cooked meal. I highly recommend everyone come experience it for themselves at least once whenever you're in Belgium(Brussels)."

I went to Quartz in Ixelles for my birthday dinner, and everything was absolutely wonderful. The interior is stunning, I loved the colors and the beautiful tile work, which added so much character to the space.
Thank you Quartz, Chef David and team, for giving us such an gourmet sensory experience.

Very cute nice place, food is haute cuisine by all rights (which means pay good money, but get good food), it was all super good. Combos were nice, wine pairings were great, they put in some extra work for our friends birthday and they were all super nice and helpful.
We accidentally stumbled across this place while out exploring town. As the food we saw people eating outside drew us in.

My favourite lunch place in Brussels. Consistently excellent quality, delicious salads - which are in fact a delightful selection of tasty, freshly prepared cooked and fresh vegetables. The sandwiches are also fantastic. Abdel's homemade kefta can't be beat!
I have visited this place multiple times but never disappointed, for a reasonable price you get a plate of salad with all veggies and meat as your prefer vegetarian options also available!
This place is amazing. I come here every time I have the chance. The food is really good and fresh. The atmosphere is cozy and the staff is so warm and welcoming.
GREAT SUSHI! Chilled atmosphere - really nice people - highly recommend. If you're not sure what to order just ask them - they're happy to help - hospitality at it's finest.

Great small sushi place close to my gym. The food is super delicious, service is amazing and very fast and the prices are very reasonable. Will come here more often, as its a hidden gem!! Definitely give it a try, you won't regret it!
Kartouche is a true hidden gem in Ixelles! I stumbled upon this restaurant by chance while browsing Google Maps and was...
Authentic Belgian food with a modern twist. Excellent service and a rather nice wine selection.

A bit overpriced for a bistro character. Food was burned, tasted like gas and was not well seasoned (they love their gas torch). As appetizer they served 2 tiny pieces of an uncooked cauliflower...the rest was not worth the hype at all.

Chef Johan's food is exceptional. His selection of food items, preparation and presentation are works of art. My wild duck breast was a master piece in flavor and cooking skill. The foie graz is like butter and the bone marrow is amazing. The scallops are the best prepared bar none. Always happen eating Chef Johan's meals.

Dined here on NYE with two. The food was outstanding, classic with a refined modern twist. What's missing on the pictures is the passion fruit infused cr√®me br√ªl√©e- one to melt away with. Loved the quality, the creativity in the...
Food, service and atmosphere all were top!! Food was very tasty, service friendly and efficient. Vibe was relaxed and professional. Well go back for sure!!!

Very stylish small hidden restaurant, mix of Belgian/french cuisine. Exceptional service, you feel really taken care of. They also have a speakeasy style cigar room. Room with grill can get very hot, that's only downside. Excellent experience otherwise.

I had the pleasure of dining at Le Corbier today with a good friend, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. The restaurant has a cozy and inviting atmosphere, with a warm grill and fireplace, tasteful decor, and soft...

Scallops and steak to die for! Beautifully decorated restaurant. Interesting cooking concept with the open fire next to you. After dinner you may have a lovely cocktail at the cigar lounge. Very polite personnel
Had Lobster and bouillabaisse, The food was amazing, staff was friendly, loved the recommendation beer so much.
friendly staff and great atmosphere! would recommend the mocktail le mignon if you love something fruity and refreshing
Very nice place and atmosfere, wonderful food and very nice and competent staff, specially Aymen

I recently dined at Le Mignon in Brussels and the experience was truly stunning. The food was incredibly delicious, fresh, and perfectly prepared. The atmosphere was wonderful and added greatly to the overall experience. A special thank you to Ayman and Khalil for the outstanding service attentive, professional, and genuinely welcoming. Everything was simply flawless. A stunning seafood restaurant that I highly recommend!

We had an amazing experience at this authentic Turkish restaurant in Brussels. The food was absolutely delicious, full of flavour, and clearly homemade with love. The atmosphere was very warm and authentic, with beautiful decor that really transported us to Turkey. We tried various meze, grilled meats and traditional dishes, and everything was wonderful. The portions are generous, and the staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a true Turkish dining experience!

One of the best Turkish meals I've ever had! You come in and a greeted by a gorgeous countertop where you can only imagine the best coffees are made. My server was incredibly welcoming and hospitable and I felt right at home. Delicious and absolutely worth a visit if you are in Brussels!

Exceptional food. Had a lovely brunch today. Host was amazing and service was spot on. Love the decor of the place. Credit to the owners. If you want to try Turkish food. You got to try this place. They do breakfast, lunch and dinner food. Very happy that I chose to come here.

Amazing Turkish restaurant. Food was incredibly delicious! Authentic decor and friendly staff. They offer a wide variety of dishes and everything was flavorful. Highly recommended for anyone who loves Turkish cuisine!
Fantastic experience! The food was authentic Turkish cuisine at its finest. The atmosphere is cozy and the staff is very welcoming. The meze platter was exceptional. Will definitely come back!
Best Turkish restaurant in Brussels. Everything from appetizers to desserts was perfect. The lahmacun was crispy and delicious. Great service too!
Very authentic Turkish experience. The decor feels like you're in Istanbul. Food quality is top-notch and prices are reasonable for what you get.
Wonderful place for Turkish food lovers. The grilled kebabs were perfectly cooked and the rice was fluffy. Staff was very attentive.
Great atmosphere, delicious food. Had the mixed grill and it was fantastic. The hummus and pide bread were also excellent.
Authentic Turkish food in a beautiful setting. The breakfast spread was amazing. Will definitely return for dinner next time.
One of the hidden gems in Brussels. Real Turkish flavors, generous portions, and friendly staff. The baklava was heaven!
Amazing experience from start to finish. The ambiance is wonderful and the food is authentic. Loved every bite!
Excellent Turkish cuisine. The meat was tender and well-seasoned. Great vegetarian options too. Highly recommended!
Beautiful restaurant with amazing food. The staff made us feel very welcome. Turkish coffee was perfect!
Delicious authentic food in a charming atmosphere. The pide was incredibly good. Will come again!

Delicious and authentic food! Very flavourful and fair prices, fresh ingredients and TOO TASTY. The staff was too lovely and took the time to explain the whole concept and menu. Its a family owned business and you can feel the love they put into it. 10/10 recommend. I am coming back

This is my first time eating here and it was so good that I came back a second time. I really liked their beef pita and their falafel pita. And the dessert was very interesting. Their pita is not just any pita, it is very thin and crispy. I highly recommend it!

Such a fun and tasty spot! Their Lebanese galettes (called kaak) are super creative‚Äîhandbag-shaped with fresh, pickled, and minty fillings that really pop. They're snack-sized, but a couple make a great dinner at a reasonable price.

Great ! A gem in Brussels! Fresh, homemade African dishes bursting with authentic flavors, generous portions, and fair prices. Cozy atmosphere, warm family-like service, like eating at an African mama's home.

Very cozy atmosphere, attentive service and even more importantly amazing food. The menu changes daily, there are 3 options (including a vegetarian one), all is fresh and cooked in front of you. We will be back!

So happy I was brought to this place, such a nice decouverte. Traditional African recipes. I loved everything we tried, the food was super tasty and the spices were delicious. The fruit juices are amazing as well. I will definitely be back.

Original food, not like your usual Greek Tavern. Of course you have gyros, but there are many other choices not seen often, including veg and gluten-free. Service is efficient and cordial. Atmosphere is nice with plenty of Greek customers.

I was unsure based on the reviews I saw on Google but it was honestly one of the best Greek cuisine experience I ever had. Finally something different from the usual tarama and blinis, here you can find other traditional Greek dishes and they are very well cooked. I would definitely come back if I am in the area
Delicious & very good service. Friendly staff and various choices in menu

Best shawarma in Brussels *Halal*  be prepared to wait 40 minutes if you want a table to sit down‚Ä¶ and if you want take it out there is still a massive queue. Every time we walked past the que never went down so just be ready to wait for this food. It is the best shawarma we had and defo worth the wait

My friends and I came from another city to eat  here. It was the most delicious durum I've ever had. We also ordered other dishes. But for me, the garlic pasta was a real discovery. Delicate but at the same time spicy, perfect consistency, creamy white color - it's perfect! The fries were perfectly fried, My shawarma with chicken and andalusian sauce won my heart, no meat spared for you here! My special love is hummus.Everything was so delicious that we left empty plates. And a nice present at the end, we were treated to a drink. Honestly, my day was hard, but this place made it so much better!

The best shawarma I've ever eaten! The meat is so delicious and juicy, it's incredible. Worth the wait! (There was a 30+ minute queue when we went) I recommend ordering the chicken durum extra spicy with the garlic sauce, it's the best combo!

I am from Lebanon and I needed to try this place! Let me tell you... This is the BEST shawarma I have ever had. The chicken was seasoned perfectly and was so juicy. I am not usually a fan of garlic sauce but this one changed my life. I also tried the Houmous and it was also very good! Overall, amazing experience!
The best shawarma I've ever had!! Worth the wait! I got mine extra spicy and extra garlic - the garlic sauce is AMAZING. Definitely try it with the white sauce combo
One of the best shawarmas I've ever had in my life! I can see why the line is always so long. The white garlic sauce is incredible! Would love to try more from them on my next visit.

I had the chicken durum with the white garlic sauce and it was absolutely phenomenal! The wait was about 30-40 minutes but it was definitely worth it. The portions are generous and the flavors are amazing.
Came here on recommendation from a local. The shawarma is incredible - probably the best I've had outside of the Middle East. The garlic sauce is addictive. Be prepared to wait though!
Incredible shawarma! The meat is perfectly cooked and seasoned. The garlic sauce is out of this world. Worth every minute of the 45-minute wait. Will definitely come back!
This place is always packed for a reason. The chicken shawarma durum is absolutely delicious. The garlic sauce makes it even better. A must-try in Brussels!
Waited 35 minutes but it was totally worth it. The shawarma is juicy, flavorful, and the portions are huge. The garlic sauce is legendary. Best street food in Brussels!
The hype is real! Amazing shawarma with the most incredible garlic sauce. Staff is friendly despite being so busy. Highly recommend!
Absolutely fantastic! The chicken durum with extra garlic sauce was heavenly. Long queue but moves reasonably fast. A Brussels must-visit!
Best shawarma experience ever! The meat is tender and full of flavor. The white sauce is amazing. Worth the wait, will definitely return.
This place deserves all the hype. Incredible flavors, generous portions, and that garlic sauce is addictive. Just be prepared for the queue!
Finally tried it after hearing so much about it. Did not disappoint! The shawarma is absolutely divine. The garlic sauce is life-changing.
Came with high expectations and they were exceeded. The chicken durum is perfection. That white garlic sauce should be bottled and sold!
Amazing food! The shawarma is so flavorful and the garlic sauce is the perfect accompaniment. Staff is friendly too. Highly recommend!
Absolutely worth the wait! The meat is so tender and juicy. The garlic sauce is incredible. Best shawarma I've had in Europe!
The queue was long but moved fast. The shawarma was excellent - juicy meat, fresh bread, and that amazing garlic sauce. Will be back!
Incredible shawarma! Worth every minute of the 40-minute wait. The garlic sauce is to die for. A must-try when in Brussels!
This is hands down the best shawarma I've ever had. The meat is perfectly seasoned, the bread is fresh, and that garlic sauce... wow!
Lived up to all the hype! The chicken durum with garlic sauce is absolutely incredible. Worth the wait, will definitely come back!
Best street food in Brussels! The shawarma is out of this world. That white garlic sauce is magical. Don't miss this place!
Amazing experience! The meat is so juicy and flavorful. The garlic sauce is perfectly balanced. A true gem in Brussels!
Phenomenal shawarma! The wait was about 30 minutes but so worth it. The flavors are incredible and portions are generous.
This place is legendary for a reason. The shawarma is incredible - tender meat, fresh ingredients, and that amazing sauce!
Worth every minute of the wait! The chicken durum is perfectly seasoned and the garlic sauce is addictive. Will return!
Exceeded all my expectations! The shawarma is truly outstanding. The garlic sauce is the best I've ever had. A must-visit!
The hype is justified! Incredible shawarma with perfect seasoning. The white garlic sauce is heavenly. Highly recommend!
Best shawarma in Brussels, maybe in all of Belgium! The meat is juicy, the bread is fresh, and that sauce is perfection!
Absolutely amazing! The chicken durum with extra garlic sauce is incredible. Staff is friendly despite the long queues.
This place delivers on all fronts. Delicious shawarma, generous portions, and that legendary garlic sauce. Worth the wait!
Finally tried it and it's even better than expected! The meat is so tender and flavorful. The garlic sauce is incredible!
Outstanding shawarma! The flavors are perfectly balanced. The garlic sauce makes everything better. A Brussels must-try!
The best durum I've ever eaten! So juicy, so flavorful. The white sauce is amazing. Will definitely be coming back!
Incredible experience! The shawarma is absolutely delicious. Worth the 40-minute wait. That garlic sauce is to die for!
This place is a gem! The chicken durum is perfection. The garlic sauce is legendary. Highly recommend to everyone!
Amazing food and worth every minute of the wait! The shawarma is so tasty and the portions are huge. Love the garlic sauce!
Best street food experience in Brussels! The shawarma is incredible. That white garlic sauce should be famous worldwide!
Absolutely fantastic! The meat is perfectly cooked and seasoned. The garlic sauce is the best I've ever had. Must try!
The queue was intimidating but moved fast. The shawarma was worth every second of waiting. Incredible flavors!
Lived up to the hype and more! The chicken durum is absolutely divine. The garlic sauce is addictive. Will return!
This is what shawarma should taste like! Tender meat, fresh bread, amazing sauce. A true Brussels institution!
Incredible! The shawarma is so flavorful and the portions are generous. The garlic sauce is the star of the show!
Worth the 45-minute wait! The meat is juicy and delicious. That legendary garlic sauce lives up to its reputation!
Best shawarma I've had in my life! The flavors are incredible. The white sauce is perfect. A must-visit in Brussels!
This place is amazing! The chicken durum with garlic sauce is heavenly. Staff is super friendly. Highly recommend!
Racist owner. He kicked us out for no reason. We just wanted to eat shawarma and he told us to leave. Never going back.
Terrible service. Waited 1 hour and then they forgot our order. When we complained, the staff was rude. Food was cold. Avoid.

Wanted to try an Indian whilst in Brussels and close to where we were staying. The food is good and spicy. The dosa, chicken biriyani and dhal was very nice. We both enjoyed the food. Little bit on the pricier side however the food was worth it.

Restaurant located near to Brussels city center and this restaurant is Halal. I ordered spicy chicken biryani and the spice hit us with goodness. I love it! the rice portion are huge that can be share 2-3 people. The hot chai-tea also good.

Walkable from a major public transport hub. The menu includes South Indian breakfast items I enjoyed a lot. The service was quite slow, but the taste was very good especially the sambar, which I'd definitely recommend.

This was our very first restaurant experience in Brussels ‚Äî and what a great way to start our trip! After a late arrival, we checked into our hotel, dropped our bags, and set out in search of a recommended place.

Such a variety of delicious mezze and meals, nice ambience. Always a full house it seems so reservations are needed; it could be quite loud though. The staff is helpful and active. Portions are generous. Very delicious experience.
I highly recommend this restaurant! Amazing Greek food, the best I have had so far in Brussels! Romantic enough for a date but also works for friends. High price-quality ratio.

We were craving fried calamari and, after a detailed search, we found this restaurant. We ordered halloumi, Greek salad, calamari, and scampi with garlic ‚Äî all the mezes were fantastic! We also tried the meatballs, which were just okay.
We had a last minute choice to make and I have to admit I had by far the best Greek food in Belgium since 2006. The service was friendly and the food was amazingly tasty.
Such a friendly place in Brussels! This is a Greek-food restaurant, located in a neighborhood outside the city center, easily reachable with bus line 66. Food there is great and their menu is big.
Absolutely love this place! Yichan is without a doubt one of my favorite spots in Brussels. The xiaolongbao...

Pros: The duck is the star dish to get. Has great outdoor seating. Cons: our server had a very bad attitude and we got the distinct impression we were annoying her by being a patron at her establishment. The pho was flavorless as were the other dishes we ordered. The food is also is extremely overpriced.

After a decade of looking for good dim sum in Brussels I discovered this restaurant and the food was soooo delicious- much better than dim sum in London. So fresh and tasty and the service was outstanding as well. It is a bit pricey though.

I'm a Falafel durum lover and I can say that here I did eat The Best one in my life! And there is not just wonderful food, is a beautiful ambiente thanks to the owner and his loving treat. I did feel in home plus I eat the best falafel

What a discovery! This place has many vegan options. Filling and nutritious homemade cuisine at a fair price. I will definitely eat here more often. Also, the owner is very friendly, and I felt very welcome. I highly recommend it!
great meal. I truly enjoyed the food and the owner is super friendly.
The young girl wiatress was extremely rude and unpolite!! Even you have a good food, the BAD service could not help.

There was a sign on the door that they had changed the management. So, as I'm curious and a foodie, I went there today to try it out. Usually, I'm having Lebanese or Lebanese style kitchen when I'm hungry and don't want to spend much money
Great food, the rakakat, soujouk and beef shawarma come heartily recommended and the desserts are to die for! We ate in, but take-out is possible as well.

Food was really good, and great value too. We sat outside and it was served fast, the salmon was cooked perfectly. The potions are large. It has people there all day always looks full, and I understand why. I will definitely return here for more.
The service was excellent and fast! At first we were worried about the portions, so we ordered 4 starters, however rest assured whoever is reading this post, they were amazingly generous!!
If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine and a quick, no-frills meal, this is the place. My favorite dish is the brochette salmon‚Äîabsolutely delicious.
Great Greek restaurant, authentic Greek vibes. Staff is very friendly and warm and will make you feel very welcomed. Food is also very good and tasty, awesome decor, authentic music.
The food was delicious and good size, the cocktail was strong (and delicious). Unfortunately for us nobody in there spoke English so that made it a bit harder to communicate.
We had a nice birthday dinner last weekend and I can only say that everything was great.The food,the atmosphere and the staff.

the staff took the time to explain all the food options to me, and helped me build my bowl. Authentic flavors, good food. A little on the pricey side, but understandable since the cuisine has fresh and healthy vegetables.

Such an amazing place for a quick meal!! All the mezzes are soo full of flavour and the bowls are very fairly priced!! I first went here with a friend who recommended it and since then I've been taking all my friends who visit Brussels here.
We've tried several plates and everything was honestly super fresh and tasty. The staff is super nice and helpful and kind as well.

One of the best Punjabi food I've had in awhile. Everything tasted AMAZING and so authentic! The person taking our order was super patient and friendly even though it was a little busy‚Äîthey even explained the different spicy levels! Would definitely recommend this place!

The food was absolutely delicious. We was looking for a authentic Indian restaurant and we can recommend this place. The food was delicious. We asked for it spicy and authentic Asian style and they delivered.
Most authentic Indian cuisine we've had in years! The flavours are insane and the portions super generous! The atmosphere of the place is also very chill and cozy, perfect for a winter dinner.

name: Saffron Food Persian & Iranian Food BBQ

reviews.text: Some up in way 1 word: ok

Firstly the capacity of the restaurant is giant secondly I would highly recommend the Persian food here and finally the men were so nice and since we were tourists they told us great places to experience in Brussels.
The food is amazing with a very nice and friendly service. Taste very authentic, for people who looking for halal and comfort food Saffron would be the best choice.
+Very delicious mezzes and wine. +Nice atmosphere and service. +Beautiful interior and cutlery.

Delicious food, fine ambiance, La Chatelaine du Liban never disappoints! If you're a fan of Lebanese cuisine, this restaurant will offer you plenty of choice. Recommend the platter of traditional mezzes with either meat skewers or veggie options. Always a pleasure!

Have had lunch here several times now and the food is delicious. Had the mix plates where you can choose your items. I've been there when they are opening and the service has been slow, but the food makes up for it.
As I just came back from India, I was craving a bit of what I had over there. While walking around, I spotted this beautifully designed place, warm, artsy, and inviting.
Loved the place‚Ä¶completely vegetarian restaurant‚Ä¶lovely staff‚Ä¶we got a lot of complimentary food..highly recommend for people who are looking for a veg restaurant..
100% a must if you like Indian. The staff, Gustavo and Alexander, were incredibly warm and attentive. Full flavors and a great experience. Come hungry!

You have to come here, at least for the atmosphere and room. Beautifully themed location with great plates and good pricing. Not the tastiest Indian food I've had, but in the top 5 in Brussels. Service is fast and sweet, plates are generous.

We ordered Fried Chicken, Oh My Gobi, Methi Chicken Tikka, and Butter Paneer as mains, plus rice and garlic naan on the side. Everything was meant to be shared, and honestly, it was all great exactly as we'd hoped.

We came looking for new experience restaurant. What a great surprise with this place. Really good vibes with a street food India decoration, quite colorful and great atmosphere. Service is good and food is really tasty.
The food was absolutely delicious, but the service subpar, which is why I'm only giving 4 stars. We came for lunch, I paid 19,50‚Ç¨ for the formule d√©jeuner (one meat + 5 mezzes).
What an experience! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. The atmosphere of the place was warm and inviting, and the location is really convenient too.
Clean restaurant, very good food, with fresh ingredients. Sometimes, they have some traditional belly dancing sessions to cheer up the clients. Friendly service, average prices.
Came by in the middle of the afternoon for a late lunch. Ordered one of the menus with 2 bread sandwiches and some fries.
Very disappointing experience. The sandwiches were completely cold and mostly filled with salad, with only a tiny amount of meat. There was so much sauce that the bread became soggy.
The sandwiches were cold and mostly salad. Used to be good before, but not anymore. Definitely not worth it.
After having Belgian food in the morning. We decided to go for comfort Greek food for dinner. There was a chill in the air.
Probably one of the best Greek restaurants in Brussels. Good quality, big portions and fair price.
Amazing food. Very good service. Greek ambience. Definitely one of the best greek restaurants in Brussels!
This food is only at the buffet, but there is plenty of meat that is coming, so don't take much cause the delicious things will come to you! Enjoy!!!
Really good Brazilian bbq/rotisserie. Food is amazing. Wide variety of choices in the buffet and high quality meat. Service is friendly and fair prices.
An authentic grilled meat. Extremely tasty. Highly recommended if you enjoy hearty meat-based dishes.

The owner and his staff are very nice and kind, we speak very little French, but this is not a problem, they will help you out! I tried the Mezzo dish recommended by other reviews, it was good! and we also ordered the grilled lamb, it was nicely done!
Very good Greek restaurant, with tasty food and very friendly staff. For the weekend, I strongly recommend to make a reservation in advance. Otherwise, top quality for decent prices.

Excellent place to eat delicious Greek dishes! A very complete menu offers so many choices of entrees, main dishes and desserts. The owner and his staff are so nice and kind. I have been there for more than 28 years and was never disappointed.
one of the best greek food that you can eat in Belgium, the service is excellent and the food is great. it is a place that you have to visit at least once a month if not more.
1502‚Ç¨ for 16 people. Almost 100‚Ç¨ per person. There are many better bars with much more better/cheaper food.
Food is really good and tasty but portions are small and therefore I find it overpriced. Service was good. The best option is to order different things and try a bit of everything!

I had high hopes for ONGBA, but left feeling rather disappointed. Starting with the drinks ‚Äì I tried a few cocktails, all of which were bland and almost tasteless, especially surprising given the price of ‚Ç¨13 each.

ONGBA provides a genuinely heartwarming and delicious Vietnamese dining experience that lives up to its name, which means 'grandparents.' The dedication to authentic, flavorful cuisine is evident in every dish.
Fantastic small plates at reasonable prices. The smelt, soft shell crab, steamed rice noodles, pickles, beef stew, and sesame ball all hit the spot. I need to go back to try the rest of the menu.
Greek restaurant adapted to Belgian taste. Food is good but not exceptional.
Very good grilled pork. Nice atmosphere and friendly service.
The food is so good and the staff is very friendly.

Chance upon this well lit restaurant at the corner and was impressed with the decor and ambience. Check the reviews and they're quite good so made a reservation to check it out. Served by a nice server named Mr Radhi who was very friendly.

We had dinner at Aux Armes de Bruxelles, a traditional brasserie serving both Belgian and French cuisine during Summer holiday. The place was full of charm and had such a welcoming buzz. Our server was nice and helpful.

Booked a dinner reservation for my parter's birthday, showed up a couple of hours late but they were gracious to still allow sitting. We were moved from a regular table to a somewhat larger table. I Had some Chicken meal as the main.

reserved a special dinner here for our 30th wedding anniversary and it surely didn't disappoint. It's our first try of a Michelin starred restaurant and we were amazed with the entree's. In addition, we were greeted with complimentary appetizers and a special dessert for our anniversary. The service was impeccable and the ambiance was perfect for a romantic dinner.

Stirwen is one of my absolute favourite restaurants in Brussels. The tasting menu is always exceptional: imaginative, surprising, and flawlessly executed. Sometimes I hear the list of ingredients (venison with chorizo and eel, for example) and wonder how it could work, but it always does. The chef has a remarkable talent for creating unexpected flavor combinations that delight the palate.

For a special occasion, this place will not let you down. The food was delicious, the service impeccable and ambiance very enjoyable. Your likes and dislikes, as well as allergies etc will be taken into consideration. Highly recommend for anniversary dinners or special celebrations.

Incredible food that is delicious, combines high quality ingredients with unique flavors, and looks pretty! I highly recommend this restaurant. Their sorbet of celery is wow! Saffron, calamari & fish with matching wine amazing.
Great as usually, I keep coming back and I have never been disappointed. Taste and visual side top level! Their sorbet of celery is wow! Saffron, calamar & fish with matching wine amazing.

A true gem in Brussels! The tasting menu was an absolute delight from start to finish. Every course was beautifully presented and the flavors were extraordinary. The wine pairing was exceptional. Will definitely return!

Exceptional dining experience. The chef's creativity shines through every dish. The service was attentive without being intrusive. Perfect for a special occasion. The venison was cooked to perfection.
One of the best restaurants in Brussels. The tasting menu is worth every euro. Innovative cuisine with perfect execution. The sommelier's recommendations were spot on. A must-visit for food lovers.

I had the lunch menu, the food was exceptional, have to say I loved the soup. The restaurant is large with several different areas to be seated in. The decor was interesting the look of an old hardware store with a mezzanine running around the main room.

By Brussels standards, this is not the cheapest restaurant, but the quality of the ingredients and dishes on the menu is unbeatable. We had dinner on a Thursday evening and the place was fully packed. The service is impeccable.
Fine dining in a beautiful atmosphere. An old hardware store. The big analog clock on the top of the stairs gives you a sense of going back in time... totally recommended.

Visited in Oct 2025. Lunch for two.
You need to first order your food at the counter. Then go find your table (like in a food court). When your food is ready, the staff will call/shout your name ...

A restaurant at a crossroads.
You place your order first, then sit at the tables, which are not comfortable.
After that, the waiter brings your order. ...
Every thing was amazing! Although wwe had to wait to find a table but the whole idea of serving food so differently was quite fun and the food quality was also great!

This place is great and always packed with people but the service is very quick! There are tables across the street but it is self service! We had the shrimp croquettes and oysters! Both were amazing and really flavourful! The atmosphere ...

Noordzee (Mer du Nord) in Brussels is a beloved spot near Sainte-Catherine Church offering incredibly fresh seafood in a casual, self-service setup. Customers order directly at the counter and enjoy their meals standing or at high tables ...

Amazing experience! Even though the kitchen wasn't fully open yet, the staff was super friendly and served me salmon tartare on fresh bread ‚Äî easily one of the best raw salmon preparations I've ever had. It was so good I came back later the same day to try more. Warm service, great food ‚Äî I'd definitely return next time I'm in Brussels

Seafood is my favorite meat.
And this place got variety of seafood.
I had fried calamaris, razor calms, fresh oysters plus a French bread with ...
Razorclam was perfect. I didnt chew much sands, well prepared. Tuna cube with sesame seed was very tasty. Oyster wasnt up to my expectations tho. Mussel was good

name: Le Chalet de la For√™t
search_query: Le Chalet de la Foret Brussels

reviews.text: It was a wonderful evening. Sitting outside on one of the hottest days and still enjoying skillfully prepared food. The sommelier suggested the perfect wines to accommodate each course and gave an insight on each choice. I especially loved the dessert.

We celebrated our anniversary at Le Chalet de la For√™t and had an unforgettable experience. The ambiance is magical, the food exquisite, and the wine and cheese selection outstanding. The staff were incredibly kind and professional everything you'd expect from a 2-star Michelin. Highly recommended!

A 2 star Michelin restaurant hidden in the middle of forests. Once you step into it you are immediately invited to the tranquility of woods. You can choose where to enjoy your aperitif: by the fire or on table. The dishes join both traditional and modern cuisine.

Everything was amazing. Service was excellent, food was generally incredible, and the wine was phenomenal. My only question was why was the beef Wellington wrapped in cabbage as opposed to a more standard prosciutto? But certainly a once in a lifetime meal.

We dined here on 30/10 for dinner to celebrate our wedding anniversary - food is top notch and the service is world class. Service is better than some of the 3 Michelin star restaurants we have been to. Definitely deserving of 2 stars and hope they get 3 soon.
A French restaurant located in the beautiful Bozar building. The service was impeccable and the food outstanding. Truly a memorable dining experience in Brussels.

From beautiful decor, to expert super friendly waiters to amazingly prepared and gorgeous tasting food and excellently paired wine. A Brussels gem and a have to go to. A little pricey but worth the spoil.

An Exceptional Dining Experience at Comme Chez Soi. Dining at Comme Chez Soi was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. As one of Brussels' most prestigious Michelin-starred restaurants, it truly lives up to its reputation.
Classic Belgian fine dining at its best. The Art Nouveau interior is stunning, the service impeccable, and the food is a perfect blend of tradition and innovation.

Amazing experience at Belga Queen! We loved everything, the food was great, service was solid, and the atmosphere great in their beautiful dining room. The beet tartare appetizer was very well-made with quality goat cheese, and the sole was cooked to perfection.

The cocktails were great. Servers were polite, but there was zero interaction. The server didn't introduce themselves, didn't speak about the menu, nor recommend any dishes. The food was okay, the escargot dish was not what I expected.
Beautiful restaurant in a former bank building. The architecture alone is worth the visit. Food quality is good but prices are on the higher end.

Lunch: not at all busy which makes it a pleasant and quiet place. 19 EUR seems little appealing and sound like croquet, potatoes and lamb. A la cart may be a 22 spaghetti vongole which remind you more of the dessert than the sea.
Nice interior design and sweet service. Cocktail is so so. But the food really really not delicious. Even ham! Don't try it!
Beautiful view, delicious food and great service and atmosphere.
Great for sunset views sitting out in their 40+ lounge chairs overlooking the gardens and city
Just sat down here for a beer and the breath taking view. The gentleman serving the beer was very hospitable and gave me plenty of useful information

I recently took my wife there for her birthday and Mother's Day celebration. We did the Diamond and Privilege menu with the wine pairing. The food was fantastic and beautifully done. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable.

We were waiting awfully long to order water and wine (over an hour). We had to ask for bread twice and had to wait 30 minutes as they didn't baked it yet...on a friday evening with a full restaurant. The service was lengthy.

I recently dined at La Truffe Noire and it was an experience that truly stood out. From the moment we walked in, the service was impeccable‚Äîattentive yet unobtrusive, with staff who were both knowledgeable and passionate about the menu.
Beautiful setting and excellent truffle-based dishes. A must for truffle lovers visiting Brussels.
Overpriced for what you get. Service was slow and the portions were small. The truffle flavor was subtle at best.
A fine dining experience with exceptional attention to detail. The truffle risotto was divine.
Good food but extremely expensive. Make sure to check prices before ordering.
One of the best restaurants in Brussels for truffle cuisine. Worth every euro.
Disappointing experience. The hype doesn't match the reality.
Excellent wine pairing and knowledgeable sommelier. Food was creative and delicious.

The most amazing culinary experience I have ever had. The full 7 course menu is definitely recommended. Most of the dishes are seafood based with exotic ingredients blended to create the best combination. I would definitely visit again. The atmosphere is also quiet and modern. The service is also top class. Definitely worthy of two stars.

This restaurant is inside the Radisson hotel. The restaurants interior design is nice and minimalist. The service was good and attentive. The food was a real pleasure. If you usually don't like seafood, you will love this. Its extremely pricey but its absolutely worthwhile. The ingredients are combined with the greatest care. All courses together were a symphony of tastes and consistency. The chef is very friendly, he came to ask how we liked it.
Exceptional seafood in an elegant setting. The lobster was perfectly cooked and the wine pairing was spot on.
Two Michelin stars well deserved. The tasting menu is a journey through the best of Belgian seafood.
Expensive but worth it for a special occasion. The service was impeccable and the food was outstanding.
A bit disappointing for the price. The portions were small and the service felt rushed.
One of the best seafood restaurants in Brussels. The chef knows how to bring out the flavors.
Beautiful presentation but the taste didn't match the hype. Expected more for a 2-star Michelin.
Perfect for business dinners. Professional service and excellent wine selection.
The seafood platter is a must-try. Fresh ingredients and creative combinations.
Visited for our anniversary. Everything was perfect from start to finish.
Good but not great. The ambiance is nice but the food didn't wow me.
Incredible dining experience. The oysters were the freshest I've ever had.
Service was slow and the waiter seemed distracted. Food was good though.
A culinary masterpiece. Every dish was a work of art and tasted divine.
Overpriced for what you get. Better seafood options elsewhere in Brussels.

What makes this place worth visiting is the great service, with staff being attentive and genuine. The set menus are good value for money and a good way to try different dishes from the menu. The pulpo starter was the highlight of the meal for me. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Perfect! I recommend 100%! It was a great experience. The atmosphere is very nice, there's a beautiful terrace outside, calm and relaxing. The atmosphere inside is also very nice and elegant. The service is great, they are always taking care that everything is alright. And most important if all: the food was PERFECT. The food was incredibly tasty, well cooked and you could feel the good quality of the products used. Plus, all the dishes came with a beautiful plate presentation, very elegant and stylish. Top!
Lovely atmosphere and excellent cocktails. The food was creative and well presented.
Good food but slow service. Had to wait quite long for our main course.
Amazing terrace for summer evenings. Food quality is consistently high.
Overpriced for the portions. The cocktails were good though.
One of my favorite restaurants in Brussels. Always a pleasure to dine here.
The tasting menu is a must. Each course was better than the last.
Nice place for a date night. Romantic atmosphere and delicious food.
Service was a bit pretentious but the food made up for it.
Great brunch options on weekends. The eggs benedict were perfect.
Disappointed with my visit. Food was cold and the waiter was rude.
Fantastic wine selection. The sommelier really knows his stuff.
Good value for the quality. Will definitely come back.
The desserts are to die for. Try the chocolate fondant!
Average experience. Nothing special but nothing bad either.

name: Le Wine Bar des Marolles
search_query: Le Wine Bar des Marolles Brussels

reviews.text: Very attentive service responding to our requests during the reservation and the dinner itself. The food was delicious all around. Highly recommend this spot if you are looking for a romantic-relaxed setting with top quality food.

I went here for a Friday night girl dinner, and personally, I enjoyed it. It was quite full, so I understand why not notifying them in advance if you might be late ‚Äî or not cancelling at all ‚Äî could be an issue.

One of the best restaurants we have been to! The food was absolutely delicious- could not flaw a single thing. The service was friendly, the atmosphere and lighting was lovely, wine was amazing and again- the food was incredible! Would recommend and will be back again once we are in Brussels again. Keep it up!

What a hidden gem! We stumbled upon this place and had an amazing evening. The wine selection is superb and the staff was incredibly knowledgeable. The food paired perfectly with our wine choices. Will definitely return!
Excellent wine bar with great atmosphere. The owner is very passionate about wine and it shows. Food was tasty and portions were generous. A bit pricey but worth it for the quality.

Cozy and intimate setting perfect for a date night. The cheese and charcuterie board was exceptional. Wine recommendations were spot on. Only giving 4 stars because it was a bit hard to get a reservation.
Wonderful experience from start to finish. The sommelier helped us choose the perfect wines to complement our meal. The beef tartare was the best I've had in Brussels!
A true gem in the Marolles neighborhood. Unpretentious atmosphere with excellent wine and food. The owner clearly cares about quality. Highly recommended!
We came for wine and stayed for the amazing food. The duck confit was perfectly cooked. Great selection of Belgian and French wines. Will be back!
Charming wine bar with a great selection. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The small plates are perfect for sharing. A must-visit in Brussels!
Fantastic spot for wine lovers. The ambiance is warm and welcoming. Food quality is exceptional. Prices are reasonable for the quality you get.
Had a lovely evening here. The wine selection is impressive and the staff helped us find exactly what we were looking for. The cheese plate was divine!
One of the best wine bars in Brussels. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed evening. The food is simple but excellently prepared. Highly recommend the beef carpaccio!
Amazing place! The owner is so passionate and knowledgeable about wine. We had a wonderful tasting experience. The food was delicious too. Can't wait to come back!
Excellent wine bar with a great atmosphere. The staff made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in. The wine selection is top-notch and the food is delicious.
A hidden gem in the Marolles! Great wines, delicious food, and friendly service. The beef tartare is a must-try. Perfect for a romantic dinner.
Visited for our anniversary and it was perfect. The wine pairing was excellent and the food was outstanding. Romantic atmosphere and attentive service.
Great wine selection and knowledgeable staff. The small plates are perfect for sharing. Cozy atmosphere perfect for catching up with friends.
Wonderful little wine bar with exceptional quality. The owner is very welcoming and the recommendations are always spot on. A Brussels must-visit!
Fantastic experience! The wine selection is extensive and the staff really knows their stuff. The charcuterie board was excellent. Will definitely return!
Lovely atmosphere and excellent wines. The food is simple but well-prepared. The cheese selection is outstanding. Perfect for a quiet evening out.
One of my favorite spots in Brussels. The wine list is impressive and the staff is always helpful. The beef tartare never disappoints!
Great wine bar with a cozy atmosphere. The owner is passionate and it shows in everything. Food is delicious and wines are well-selected.
Excellent service and amazing wines. The food portions are generous and everything is fresh. A real gem in the Marolles neighborhood.
Had a wonderful dinner here. The wine recommendations were perfect and the food was delicious. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. Highly recommend!
A true wine lover's paradise. Great selection, knowledgeable staff, and excellent food. The prices are fair for the quality. Will be back!
Charming place with a great wine selection. The staff is friendly and helpful. The cheese and charcuterie boards are excellent. Perfect for a casual evening.
Wonderful experience from start to finish. The wines are excellent and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is perfect for a romantic evening.
One of the best wine bars I've been to. The selection is impressive and the staff is knowledgeable. The food is simple but excellent.
Great spot for wine lovers. The atmosphere is cozy and the staff is welcoming. The food pairs perfectly with the wines. Highly recommend!
Excellent wine bar with a fantastic selection. The owner is very knowledgeable and passionate. The food is delicious too. A must-visit in Brussels!
Lovely little wine bar in a great location. The wine selection is impressive and the food is tasty. The staff is friendly and attentive.
Had a great time here. The wines are excellent and the food is delicious. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed evening with friends.
Fantastic wine bar with a great atmosphere. The staff is knowledgeable and helpful. The cheese plate is a must-try. Will definitely return!
One of the best spots in the Marolles. The wine selection is top-notch and the food is excellent. The owner is very welcoming. Highly recommend!
Great wine bar with an excellent selection. The staff helped us find the perfect wines for our meal. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting.
Wonderful place for wine lovers. The selection is impressive and the staff is knowledgeable. The food is simple but delicious. A real gem!
Excellent experience! The wines are superb and the food is tasty. The atmosphere is perfect for a quiet dinner. Will be back!
Had a lovely evening here. The wine recommendations were spot on and the food was delicious. The staff is friendly and welcoming.
Great wine bar with a fantastic atmosphere. The owner is passionate about wine and it shows. The food is excellent too. Highly recommend!
Service was disappointingly slow and the staff seemed overwhelmed. The food was good but not worth the long wait. Wine selection was nice though.
Overpriced for what you get. The wine was good but the food portions were small. Nice atmosphere but I expected more for the price.
Good wine but the service was lacking. We waited a long time to be served and the staff seemed disinterested. Food was decent.
The owner was rude when we asked for recommendations. The wine was fine but the experience was ruined by the poor service. Won't return.
Nice place but overrated. The wines are good but nothing exceptional. Food is average. I've been to better wine bars in Brussels.
Disappointing experience. The place was too crowded and noisy. Couldn't hear ourselves talk. Food was okay but not worth the hassle.
Average wine bar. Nothing special about the wine selection or food. Service was slow. There are better options in the area.
Not impressed. The wines were overpriced and the food was mediocre. The atmosphere was nice but that's about it. Won't be coming back.
Terrible experience. The staff was unfriendly and the service was incredibly slow. The food was cold when it arrived. Avoid this place.
Disappointed with my visit. The wine selection was limited and the prices were too high. The food was nothing special. Expected more.

Food is great
- food is tasty and I would come back.
- prices are normal. Expected for the location. The restaurant itself isn't the biggest but they have a good turn around of customers.
Really good Pho! Had a bowl of beef pho here and it was exactly what I needed in this cold winter weather. Rich, comforting broth, generous portion, and full of flavour.
We regularly visit this restaurant in Brussels. We really like b√∫n-ƒë·∫≠u-m·∫Øm t√¥m, b√∫n-c√°, and we often request an extra Fried-tofu. The food make us feel at home, just like in Viet Nam.

The food in this Vietnamese place is super tasty and the prices are good! Unfortunately, there are not many seats so either you book or you wait. After ordering and paying, you sit down somewhere and wait for a member to bring your order to you. However, the system is so effective that you never have to wait more than 5 minutes.

In a nutshell, their food is great, affordable, but service is questionable. The food was absolutely delicious and the price was great. Our waiter was nice too, though a bit absent minded. I ordered the coconut milk with mushrooms and the curry was very mild and delicious. The mushrooms were fresh, the vegetables were all in right amounts, the rice was not undercooked.

It was a super great experience ! The food is really good, we tried the fried rice, some scampi roll and ha cao. The three of them were excellent, hot and nicely flavored. The iced coffee is really to die for. Everything was great and the ambiance as well.
The food is nice. I ordered beef pho (quite average though) and winter rolls. No Visa or MasterCard, only cash or Bancontact. Quick service and nice atmosphere and decoration.
Great Pho. We try here another food soon.
Super good Vietnamese food. The pad Thai is really good. My favourite are the bo bun though. The portions are huge. Take out option available.
I was disappointed with the quality of the fresh spring rolls. For this price I expected freshly made rolls, not pre-made ones from the fridge with not so fresh shrimp considering costs.
Really nice food! Authentic Vietnamese cuisine with reasonable prices. The pho is amazing and the spring rolls are fresh. Service can be slow during peak hours but overall a great experience.
Excellent Vietnamese restaurant! The bun cha was absolutely delicious and reminded me of Hanoi. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.
Good food but small portions for the price. The pho was tasty but I expected more noodles. Nice ambiance though.
One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Brussels. The coconut curry is exceptional. Highly recommended!
Fresh ingredients, authentic flavors. The spring rolls are made to order and you can taste the difference. Will come back!
Nice place for a quick Vietnamese meal. The bo bun is very filling and flavorful. Service was efficient.
The pho here is the closest I've found to what I had in Vietnam. Aromatic broth and tender beef. Perfect for cold days.
Tasty food but the restaurant can get quite crowded. Make sure to book in advance for dinner.
Love this place! The staff is super friendly and the food is consistently good. The fried tofu is a must-try.
Authentic Vietnamese cuisine at reasonable prices. The atmosphere is casual but welcoming. Great for lunch.
The bun bo hue was amazing! Spicy and flavorful, just like in Vietnam. Will definitely return.
Good food overall but nothing exceptional. The service was quick and efficient.
Best pho in Brussels! The broth is rich and the meat is tender. Highly recommend the rare beef pho.
Nice little restaurant with authentic Vietnamese food. The banh mi is excellent and very affordable.
The com chien (fried rice) was delicious and generous portion. Great value for money.
Decent Vietnamese food but I've had better in other places. The service was friendly though.
Absolutely love this place! The pho is perfect for rainy Brussels days. The staff remembers regular customers.
Fresh spring rolls and tasty noodle soups. Small space but cozy atmosphere. Worth a visit!
The curry dishes are excellent here. Not too spicy but full of flavor. Great vegetarian options too.
Good authentic Vietnamese food. The bo bun is my favorite - fresh and filling.
Amazing pho! The broth is so flavorful and the portion is huge. Best Vietnamese in the area.
Nice restaurant with quick service. The food is tasty but the seating is limited.
The summer rolls are fresh and delicious. Great option for a light and healthy lunch.
Excellent food and reasonable prices. The pad thai and pho are both outstanding.
Tasty Vietnamese cuisine in a casual setting. The staff is helpful with recommendations.
One of my go-to places for Vietnamese food. The bun cha is always on point.
Good food but can be crowded during lunch rush. Come early or book ahead.
The pho here warms my soul. Perfect comfort food with authentic flavors.
Fresh ingredients and generous portions. The coconut curry is my favorite dish here.
Decent Vietnamese food at fair prices. Nothing fancy but consistently good.
Love the atmosphere and the food is excellent. The fried spring rolls are crispy and delicious.
Great place for a quick and tasty meal. The service is fast and efficient.
The best Vietnamese restaurant I've been to in Brussels. Everything we ordered was delicious.
Good food but small seating area. Better for takeaway during busy hours.
Authentic and delicious! The pho is exactly what you'd expect in Vietnam.
Nice variety of dishes and everything is freshly made. The staff is very friendly.
Tasty food at reasonable prices. The bo bun is particularly good here.
One of the best Vietnamese spots in Brussels. The pho and spring rolls are must-tries.
Good authentic Vietnamese cuisine. The restaurant is small but charming.
Excellent food quality and friendly service. Will definitely come back!
Definitely one of the best spots in Brussels. I've been going there for almost 3 years, and I'm totally satisfied. The best concept is making their fresh kebabs with actual coals and fire.

Wow! This place is amazing! Delicious Turkish food that obviously doing something right because it was always packed while we were there, meat constantly on the grill on kebabs and yogurt drink being made fresh for all. This was my wife's favorite place.

Absolutely the best place I've been so far in Belgium.. The staff is very friendly. The place is a little small, but the food is worth it.. Just try the mix kebab and taste all of the different kebabs.. All of them are delicious..
Serves raw chicken sometimes. Need to cook a bit longer.
The staff is very friendly and the portions are big. The lahmacun is to die for.
Great food, friendly service. Best kebab in Brussels in my opinion.
Great food. Just a little bit slow on service but the wait is worth it.
Really good kebabs. The lamb is very tender and flavorful. Highly recommended!
Best kebab in Brussels! Fresh ingredients and amazing taste. Must try!
Good meat without fat or sauce
Very good Turkish food. Quick service and delicious kebabs.
Nice food and service.
